descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of public virtue or its relevance.
Demonstrates a very limited understanding of public virtue.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of public virtue but struggles to explain its importance.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of public virtue and can explain its general importance.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of public virtue, explains its importance with relevant examples.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of public virtue, explains its importance thoroughly, and provides insightful examples.
Shows no awareness of the roles and responsibilities of citizens.
Shows minimal awareness of the roles and responsibilities of citizens.
Identifies a few roles of citizens but struggles to explain their significance.
Identifies several roles of citizens and explains their significance adequately.
Clearly articulates the various roles of citizens and explains their importance in a democratic society.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the diverse roles of citizens and provides insightful analysis of their impact.
Shows no understanding of how to participate in classroom, community, or civic life.
Shows limited understanding of how to participate in classroom, community, or civic life.
Identifies a few ways to participate but struggles to articulate the impact of participation.
Identifies several ways to participate and articulates the potential impact of participation.
Demonstrates a clear understanding of how to participate actively and explains the benefits of civic engagement.
Demonstrates exceptional understanding of how to participate effectively and provides insightful examples of impactful civic engagement.
